auditorium

Class Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • auditorium.Key

  • public class Key
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents one half of an asymmetric cryptographic key; as such it can be used for signing, as well as either encryption or decryption. It is an RSA key defined by a modulus and a single exponent (both using BigInteger math). Also included is an identifier (helpful for associating the key with, for example, an external entity) and a free-form annotation.

    Its S-expression representation (used for wire-protocol transmission as well as storage, e.g. in a SimpleKeyStore) is:

    (key id annotation mod exp)

    See Also:
    sexpression

    • Constructor Detail

      • Key

        public Key(java.lang.String id,
   java.lang.String annotation,
   java.math.BigInteger mod,
   java.math.BigInteger key)
        Parameters:
        id - The key belongs to the host that has this ID
        annotation - The key is annotated with this string (usually something about how the key is supposed to be used)
        mod - This is the key's modulus, the product of two large primes.
        key - This is the actual key material (in RSA, it is an exponent).

      • Key

        public Key(ASExpression expression)
    throws IncorrectFormatException
        Parameters:
        expression - Construct the key from this expression. This should be the get in s-expression format (like what is returned from toASE())
        Throws:
        IncorrectFormatException - This method throws if the given expression is not formatted correctly.

    • Method Detail

      • toASE

        public ASExpression toASE()
        Construct an s-expression which represents this key.
        Returns:
        This method returns (key [id] [annotation] [mod] [exp]).

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns:
        This method returns the ID of the host that this key belongs to.

      • getAnnotation

        public java.lang.String getAnnotation()
        Returns:
        This method returns the annotation string given to this key.

      • getMod

        public java.math.BigInteger getMod()
        Returns:
        This method returns the key's modulus number.

      • getKey

        public java.math.BigInteger getKey()
        Returns:
        This method returns the key's exponent.
